name: Dad's New Zealand Mince Stew
author: Kat
summary: Hmmmmm... I'm not sure if it's chili, or stew or a shepherds pie without the crust, but there is nothing like it over some toast on a cold night, rich and hearty, just downright yummy if you ask me. We always experiment a little with our ingredients but it always comes out great. I'm thinking of going and making a pot right now, oh and it's even better the days after you make it, just go ahead and microwave some, put it on baked potatoes, roll it up in bread, use it anyway you like.
directions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat
Saute onions until browned; remove from pot, and set aside
Add ground beef to pot, and cook until evenly brown
Add garlic, and cook for 2 minutes
Stir in browned onions, and cook on high heat for 3 to 5 minutes
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes
Stir in ketchup, beef stock, and teriyaki sauce
Season with pepper, curry powder, garlic powder, and onion powder
Cover, and simmer for about 2 hours
Mix together 1 tablespoon flour and 1/2 cup water
Stir into stew, and cook until thickened
